column1: Owls are solitary nocturnal birds of prey.  They must have been fairly common in the northern parts of Middle-earth in the Third Age
column2: for when the Thorin and Company sent Bilbo Baggins to spy on the Trolls he was told that if he could not come back he was to "hoot twice like a barn-owl and once like a screech-owl".  Thus the Dwarves assumed that Bilbo was familiar with the exact calls that these two types of owls produced.  Much later
